mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an6.63:2.2.pli: Kāmā, bhikkhave, veditabbā, kāmānaṁ nidānasambhavo veditabbo, kāmānaṁ vemattatā veditabbā, kāmānaṁ vipāko veditabbo, kāmanirodho veditabbo, kāmanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbā.
an6.63:2.2.en: Sensual pleasures should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.

an6.63:3.1.pli: Vedanā, bhikkhave, veditabbā, vedanānaṁ nidānasambhavo veditabbo, vedanānaṁ vemattatā veditabbā, vedanānaṁ vipāko veditabbo, vedanānirodho veditabbo, vedanānirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbā.
an6.63:3.1.en: Feelings should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.

an6.63:4.1.pli: Saññā, bhikkhave, veditabbā, saññānaṁ nidānasambhavo veditabbo, saññānaṁ vemattatā veditabbā, saññānaṁ vipāko veditabbo, saññānirodho veditabbo, saññānirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbā.
an6.63:4.1.en: Perceptions should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.

an6.63:5.1.pli: Āsavā, bhikkhave, veditabbā, āsavānaṁ nidānasambhavo veditabbo, āsavānaṁ vemattatā veditabbā, āsavānaṁ vipāko veditabbo, āsavanirodho veditabbo, āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbā.
an6.63:5.1.en: Defilements should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.

an6.63:6.1.pli: Kammaṁ, bhikkhave, veditabbaṁ, kammānaṁ nidānasambhavo veditabbo, kammānaṁ vemattatā veditabbā, kammānaṁ vipāko veditabbo, kammanirodho veditabbo, kammanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbā.
an6.63:6.1.en: Deeds should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.

an6.63:7.1.pli: Dukkhaṁ, bhikkhave, veditabbaṁ, dukkhassa nidānasambhavo veditabbo, dukkhassa vemattatā veditabbā, dukkhassa vipāko veditabbo, dukkhanirodho veditabbo, dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbā.
an6.63:7.1.en: Suffering should be known. And its source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation should be known.

an6.63:8.1.pli: ‘Kāmā, bhikkhave, veditabbā, kāmānaṁ nidānasambhavo veditabbo, kāmānaṁ vemattatā veditabbā, kāmānaṁ vipāko veditabbo, kāmanirodho veditabbo, kāmanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbā’ti, iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ.
an6.63:8.1.en: ‘Sensual pleasures should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’ That’s what I said,

an6.63:14.2.pli: Kāmā, bhikkhave, veditabbā …pe… kāmanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti,
an6.63:14.2.en: ‘Sensual pleasures should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’

an6.63:15.1.pli: Vedanā, bhikkhave, veditabbā …pe… vedanānirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti,
an6.63:15.1.en: ‘Feelings should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’

an6.63:20.2.pli: Vedanā, bhikkhave, veditabbā …pe… vedanānirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti,
an6.63:20.2.en: ‘Feelings should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’

an6.63:21.1.pli: Saññā, bhikkhave, veditabbā …pe… saññānirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti,
an6.63:21.1.en: ‘Perceptions should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’

an6.63:26.2.pli: Saññā, bhikkhave, veditabbā …pe… saññānirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti.
an6.63:26.2.en: ‘Perceptions should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’

an6.63:27.1.pli: Āsavā, bhikkhave, veditabbā …pe… āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti,
an6.63:27.1.en: ‘Defilements should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’

an6.63:32.2.pli: Āsavā, bhikkhave, veditabbā …pe… āsavanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti.
an6.63:32.2.en: ‘Defilements should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’

an6.63:33.1.pli: Kammaṁ, bhikkhave, veditabbaṁ …pe… kammanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti, iti kho panetaṁ vuttaṁ.
an6.63:33.1.en: ‘Deeds should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’ That’s what I said,

an6.63:38.2.pli: Kammaṁ, bhikkhave, veditabbaṁ …pe… kammanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti,
an6.63:38.2.en: ‘Deeds should be known. And their source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to their cessation should be known.’

an6.63:39.1.pli: Dukkhaṁ, bhikkhave, veditabbaṁ, dukkhassa nidānasambhavo veditabbo, dukkhassa vemattatā veditabbā, dukkhassa vipāko veditabbo, dukkhanirodho veditabbo, dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti.
an6.63:39.1.en: ‘Suffering should be known. And its source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation should be known.’

an6.63:44.2.pli: Dukkhaṁ, bhikkhave, veditabbaṁ, dukkhassa nidānasambhavo veditabbo, dukkhassa vemattatā veditabbā, dukkhassa vipāko veditabbo, dukkhanirodho veditabbo, dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā veditabbāti.
an6.63:44.2.en: ‘Suffering should be known. And its source, diversity, result, cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation should be known.’

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an5.272:3.1.pli: Pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhattuddesako sammato na pesetabbo …pe… sammato pesetabbo … bālo veditabbo … paṇḍito veditabbo … khataṁ upahataṁ attānaṁ pariharati … akkhataṁ anupahataṁ attānaṁ pariharati … yathābhataṁ nikkhitto evaṁ niraye … yathābhataṁ nikkhitto evaṁ sagge.
an5.272:3.1.en: A person with five qualities who has been appointed as meal designator should not be called upon … should be called upon … should be known as a fool … should be known as astute … they keep themselves broken and damaged … they keep themselves unbroken and undamaged … is cast down to hell … is raised up to heaven.

mlDocs.title:

mlDocs.author: Bhikkhu Sujato

an10.22:2.3.pli: yathā yathā vā pana taṁ ñāteyyaṁ vā daṭṭheyyaṁ vā sacchikareyyaṁ vā tathā tathā ñassati vā dakkhati vā sacchikarissati vā’ti ṭhānametaṁ vijjati.
an10.22:2.3.en: And they will know or see or realize it in whatever way it should be known or seen or realized. This is possible.
